1350/A0/06/004/001.status_value: ENIPLA has been abolished and substituted by Plan Familia (a multisector but non-rights based strategy on pregnancy prevention). A Flexible Education Strategy for adolescents with severe delay (over 3 years)  has been institutionalized  and does include a holistic approach of crossectoral issues.
1350/A0/06/004/001.indicator_name: Multi-sectorial policies and services of education  health  sports and protection include a comprehensive development approach and adolescent participation  with an equity and gender equality perspective.
1350/A0/06/004/001.headline: Adolescent participation strategies results relate to adolescent development issues such as sexual and reproductive rights  protection from violence  discrimination  child justice  and disaster risk mitigation. Adolescent pregnancy as a priority issue for adolescent development will be addressed as an inter-sectoral strategy including protection  health and education.
1350/A0/06/004/001.baseline_value: National Strategy for Family Planning and Prevention of Adolescent Pregnancy and Violence (ENIPLA)

1350/A0/06/004/001.status_value: UNICEF supported the consolidation of an Afro descent youth network (Mi abuelita me decia)  the Children and Adolescents Social Movement for Children´s Rights  and has continued to support the Positive Youth Network (VIH). UNICEF included in its cooperation agreement with indigenous movements the reactivation of the indigenous children agenda  which includes indigenous children and adolescent participation  and may consolidate a network.
